struct  eolBackground
struct  eolLevelLayer
 the structure used to house the level layer data. The engine supports multiple layers. Your game does not have to. More...
struct  eolLevel

Typedefs

typedef void(* eolSpawnGeneric )(eolSpawn *spawn)
 function pointer prototype used to spawn the entities for the level the application will receive a name and a hash. The hash is keyed on the name of keys (such as position) and a value string (such as "0.3 0.5, 7.4"). The function will be called by the level when the level is created

Enumerations

enum  eolLevelDrawModes { eolLevelDrawClip, eolLevelDrawMesh, eolLevelDrawFull }

Functions

void eol_level_init ()
 frees all loaded level data.
void eol_level_config ()
 loads config for level system from file or sets up defaults.
void eol_level_clear ()
 frees all loaded level data.
eolBool eol_level_initialized ()
eolLevel * eol_level_new ()
 allocates an empty level struct and returns a pointer to it.
eolLevelLayer * eol_level_add_layer (eolLevel *level)
 allocated an empty level layer, adds it to the level in question and returns a pointer to the newly created layer.
eolBackground * eol_level_add_background_to_layer (eolLevelLayer *layer)
 allocated an empty background, adds it to the layer in question and returns a pointer to the newly created background.
eolLevel * eol_level_load (char *filename)
 allocates and loads a level from file. This function will not load any of the assets referred to by the level, such as background images It will merely load the data from the file specified. A call to eol_level_setup is needed to load the assets and spawn the entities
void eol_level_free (eolLevel **level)
 frees the level passed and sets the pointer to it to NULL
void eol_level_setup (eolLevel *level)
 sets up a loaded level for use. Including spawning all entities
void eol_level_update (eolLevel *level)
 steps through an iteration of game time. Calls collision updates.
void eol_level_register_spawn_generic (eolSpawnGeneric spawnGeneric)
 registers the generic entity spawn function with the level system. only one can be registered at a time
void eol_level_draw_current ()
 draws the current level.
void eol_level_draw (eolLevel *level)
 draws the level focused on the active layer.
void eol_level_draw_clip (eolLevel *level)
 draws the active layer's clip mask and level bounds
void eol_level_set_active_layer (eolLevel *level, eolUint layer)
 sets which layer in the level has the focus and gets updated.
void eol_level_set_current_level (eolLevel *level)
 sets the passed in level as the active level for rendering and updating.
void eol_level_update_active ()
 runs the physics simulation for the active layer. Runs pre and post sync for entities
void eol_level_add_mask_to_space (eolLevelLayer *layer)
void eol_level_add_entity_to_layer (eolLevelLayer *layer, eolEntity *ent)
 adds and entity's body and shape to the layer space for physics. The entity should have the body and shape defined previously.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* eolSpawnGeneric)(eolSpawn *spawn)

function pointer prototype used to spawn the entities for the level the application will receive a name and a hash. The hash is keyed on the name of keys (such as position) and a value string (such as "0.3 0.5, 7.4"). The function will be called by the level when the level is created

Definition at line 48 of file eol_level.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum eolLevelDrawModes

To provide a handler for the generic featured common to all 2D game levels. It will provide support for: Tile Based levels and 3D mesh based levels. layered levels

Enumerator:
eolLevelDrawClip 
eolLevelDrawMesh 
eolLevelDrawFull

Returns:

eolLevel* eol_level_load ( char *  filename  ) 

allocates and loads a level from file. This function will not load any of the assets referred to by the level, such as background images It will merely load the data from the file specified. A call to eol_level_setup is needed to load the assets and spawn the entities

Parameters:
filename the name of the level file to load
Returns:
a pointer to the loaded level from file.
eolLevel* eol_level_new (  ) 

allocates an empty level struct and returns a pointer to it.

Returns:
a pointer to an allocated, but empty level, or NULL on error.

Parameters:
